medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's depressive illness began at age 24 (September 1975). She experienced symptoms including depression, inability to concentrate, frequent weeping, guilt feelings, physical complaints, loss of libido, anorexia, and insomnia. Her condition cleared in 2 weeks after treatment with imipramine but recurred the next month with similar symptoms lasting 8 days. She then began to have depressive attacks lasting 6-10 days every month, characterized by endogenous depression symptoms. After several serious suicide attempts, she was admitted to the hospital in December 1976 for a depressive attack.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous episodes of severe depression, serious suicide attempts, maintenance doses of tricyclic antidepressants that were ineffective in preventing recurrence.
medical_history.family_history: All siblings had cyclothymic personalities; one sibling exhibited more pronounced mood swings.
medical_history.social_history: Married with two healthy daughters. No remarks on smoking, alcohol consumption, or drug use.
